note: A presentation of methods for evaluating the reliability of regression estimates.
title: Regression Diagnostics: Ident(fying Influential Data and Sources of Co/linearity
Data Reduction and Error Analysis for the Physical Sciences
An introduction to data analysis, with emphasis on propagation of error and calculation
Mathematical Statistics: Basic Ideas and Selected Topics
A thorough treatment of the mathematical principles of statistics, at a fairly advanced level
Empirical Model-Building and Response Surfaces
An excellent practical introduction to the fitting of curves and higher-order surfaces to data
Statistics for Experimenters
A very intuitive and practical introduction to the basic princ iples of data analysis and experimental design

note: An excellent introductory text at the undergraduate level, more rigorous than Chatfield (2003).
title: Introduction to Time Series and Forecasting
Statistical Inference
A fairly rigorous development of the theory of statistics

note: An intuitive presentation, at a somewhat less advanced level than Brockwell and Davis
title: An Analysis of Time Series: An Introduction
Statistics for Technology
A clear and concise introduction to basic principles of statistics, oriented toward engineers and scientists
Sampling Techniques
A comprehensive account of sampling theory
Computing and Graphics
A presentation of graphical methods for analyzing data with l inear models, with an emphasis on graphical methods
Probability and Statistics
A very readable introduction at a somewhat higher mathematical level than this book

note: An extensive and authoritative treatment of linear regression.
title: Applied Regression Analysis
An Introduction to the Bootstrap
A clear and comprehensive introduction to bootstrap methods
Statistics
An excellent intuitive introduction to the fundamental principles of statistics
Methods and Applications of Linear Models: Regression and the Analysis of Variance
A thorough treatment of the theory and applications of regression and analysis of variance

note: An up-to-date treatment of the subject with emphasis on industrial engineering.
title: Modern Industrial Statistics
An Introduction to Mathematical Statistics and Its Applications
An introduction to statistics at a higher mathematical level than that of this book. Contains many good examples
Bayesian Statistics: An Introduction
A clear and basic introduction to statistical methods that are based on the subjective view of probability

note: Thorough presentation of basic distribution-free methods.
title: Nonparametrics: Statistical Methods Based on Ranks
Subset Selection in Regression
A strong and concise treatment of the basic principles of model selection
Introduction to Statistical Quality Control
A comprehensive and readable introduction to the subject
Introduction to the Theory of Statistics
A classic introduction to mathematical statistics and an excellent reference

note: An intuitive and philosophical presentation of some very practical ideas.
title: Data Analysis and Regression
Mathematical Statistics and Data Analysis
A good blend of theory and practice, at a somewhat higher level than this book

note: A mathematically sophisticated introduction to probability.
title: A First Course in Probability

note: An introduction at a somewhat higher mathematical level than this book.
title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists
The Lady Tasting Tea
An insightful discussion of the influence of statistics on 20th-century science, with many fascinating anecdotes about famous statisticians
Statistics: A Guide to the Unknown
A collection of case studies illustrating a variety of statistical applications
An Introduction to Error Analysis
A thorough treatment of propagation of error, along with a selection of other topics in data analysis
The Visual Display of Quantitative Information
A clear and compelling demonstration of the principles of effective statistical graphics, containing numerous examples
Exploratory Data Analysis
A wealth of techniques for summarizing and describing data

note: An introduction to statistics at a somewhat higher mathematical level than this book.
title: Mathematical Statistics with Applications
Applied Linear Regression
A concise introduction to the application of linear regression models, including diagnostics, model building, and interpretation of output
